author: Mas
text:
I have bought from Vestiaire a few times now. On two occasions I have been sent bags which are NOT authentic despite them charging me for “authenticity”. 

The first one was a YSL bag and it was SO obvious that it was a fake. I sent it back and they accepted it was fake and refunded. Just to give you an idea - there was no brand stamping on the zips and hardware and it just looked so cheap. 

 The second one was a Celine vintage bag. It wasn’t even a good fake! It was so amateur! What are these “authenticity experts” doing? I sent it back and they think it matches the standards? The Celine logo wasn’t even straight! The logo tag was an odd uneven shape!! The hardware wasn’t brand stamped or metal! Soooo amateur! The leather isn’t even real leather. Anyone who knows designer bags and has owned them could tell. I think it’s so they don’t have to admit that they’ve done this to me AGAIN! They either don’t care and want sales or their authenticity experts are not very effective.

Extremely disappointed with this recent “review” and I urge everyone to be really wary when buying from them as there’s a lot of people trying to sell fakes on there. 

I’ve got ALL the photos and all the proof. I can’t attach them on here or I would so you can all judge for yourself what their “authenticity experts” are doing.
title: BEWARE of FAKES! Authenticity checks are terrible and amateur.

author: Claire
text:
I was excited to order a vintage mulberry handbag and reassured by their authentication process. I paid £282. After using the handbag a few weeks, I noticed that a part of it had fallen off and when I checked closer I noticed that the leather connecting to the hardware was reinforced with cardboard (which was now tearing off in pieces). I then checked the serial number online and it was confirmed as a fake. I sent detailed information to customer service and they told me to return it and the authentication team would check it again. 
They confirmed the handbag as real! Refusing to refund it they said they would relist it for sale! I said I would report them to Trading Standards for knowingly selling counterfeit items so am now pursuing a refund that route and through my credit card company. Honestly I thought they were legitimate but just a bunch of crooks and more expensive than the fakes on ebay. Live and learn, won't use them again.
title: Counterfeit goods knowingly sold
